snippet: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Israel would take “unilateral steps” in response to the Palestinians’ move last week to join international conventions.
abstract: Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu says Israel will take its own 'unilateral steps' in response to the Palestinians’ move to join international conventions; clearly tries to lay blame for possible collapse of peace negotiations on his counterpart, Pres Mahmoud Abbas of Palestinian Authority, but leaves open a window for salvaging talks before their expiration date.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Israel would take “unilateral steps” in response to the Palestinians’ move last week to join international conventions.

headline.main: Israel Warns Palestinians but Stays Open to Talks
headline.print_headline: Israel Warns Palestinians but Stays Open to Talks
